docs.title: Welcome to Webley
docs.text:
Webley is a modern, lightweight Python web framework designed for speed, simplicity, and developer-friendly design.

Webley makes building web applications straightforward while giving you the flexibility to customize routes, handle requests directly, and control responses. Its minimalistic approach allows you to focus on what really matters—your application logic—without unnecessary boilerplate.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Installing Webley is straightforward and requires minimal setup. It runs on Python 3.10+ without any extra configuration.

docs.title: Installing via PyPI Recommended
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Webley is through PyPI. It’s a one-line command with no additional downloads required.

  1. Open your terminal or command prompt.

  2. Run the installation command:

    pip install webley

  3. Verify the installation:

    python -c "import webley; print('Webley version:', webley.__version__)"

Tip

To keep your project dependencies isolated, consider using a virtual environment:

python -m venv env
source env/bin/activate  # macOS/Linux
env\Scripts\activate     # Windows
pip install webley

docs.title: Installing from GitHub Development Version
docs.text:
For the latest features or if you plan to contribute to Webley, you can install directly from GitHub. This gives you access to updates before they are released on PyPI.

  1. Clone the repository:

    git clone https://github.com/DevByEagle/Webley.git
cd Webley

  2. Install Webley:

    pip install .

  3. Verify the installation:

    python -c "import webley; print('Webley version:', webley.__version__)"

Info

Installing from GitHub is ideal for testing cutting-edge features. For most users, PyPI remains the recommended option.

docs.title: Customization
docs.text:
Webley offers extensive flexibility through configuration options, allowing you to tailor routing, responses, middleware, and more to your project’s needs.

Some configurable features include:

  • Route parameters and URL parsing

These are just a few examples—more options can be found in the API Reference.

docs.title: Defining Routes
docs.text:
Webley makes it simple to define routes and return HTTP responses. Here’s a quick example that responds with "Hello, Webley!" when visiting the root URL:

Hello Webley App
import webley as wb

@wb.route("/")
def home(request):
    return wb.http.HttpResponse(b"<h1>Hello, Webley!</h1>")

wb.run()

For a detailed overview of Webley classes like HttpRequest and HttpResponse, along with routing, middleware, and response options, see the API Reference.

docs.title: Packages
docs.text:
Below is a list of the core packages included in Webley and their descriptions.

Package Description webley.http Core HTTP classes (HttpRequest & HttpResponse) for handling requests, headers, and responses.

docs.title: HttpRequest
docs.text:
Represents an HTTP request received by the Webley server. It encapsulates request data such as the path, HTTP method, headers, query parameters, and body.

interface HttpRequest {
    path: string;
    method: string;
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Attribute Description Default path The URL path of the request (e.g., "/", "/users"). "" method The HTTP method used for the request (e.g., "GET", "POST"). None

docs.title: HttpResponse
docs.text:
Represents an HTTP response returned to the client. Allows setting the status code, headers, and content.

interface HttpResponse {
    status_code: number;
    headers: Dictionary<string, string>;
    content: bytes;
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Attribute Description Default status_code The HTTP status code (e.g., 200, 404, 500). "200"
